definition: to develop/to evolve/to practice/to perform/to play/to act

sentences.english: Feng's high-profile in entertainment industry is bound to bring into broad controversy.
sentences.chinese: 鳳姐此次高調進軍演藝界勢必會帶來爭議。

sentences.english: Yeah, she is not a goner . She's still active in the show biz .
sentences.chinese: 她還沒有不行，在演藝界她還是很活躍的呢。

sentences.english: He followed in his famous brother's footsteps to a career in acting.
sentences.chinese: 他繼成名的胞兄爾後，也走入演藝界。

sentences.english: But because of the static grace resolution entertainment industry.
sentences.chinese: 靜恩卻由於英兆的話決議分開演藝界。

sentences.english: He is pure and honest even though he is in the show business for a long time.
sentences.chinese: 儘管他在演藝界很多年了，但他依然是純淨且真誠的。
它的樂手排斥演藝界的浮華。

definition: to reveal outstanding talent (idiom); to stand out as conspicuously brilliant
venturing from one's thatched hut for the first time (idiom)/young and inexperienced/novice/greenhorn
to win instant success (idiom)/to become an instant hit
both fame and fortune (idiom)/both virtue and reward
to have the power to rally supporters
the man (or woman) of the moment (idiom)/influential figure
to recruit talent/to round up/to enlist the services of sb
